title: Found unstable fingerprints for `item_children`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/5b9d468201e8825b0429ea7439e79cf3ff1bf3fd, and then renamed the top-level directory from `rust` to `rustc`. I expected to see this happen: The compiler can bootstrap itself (possibly giving an error about the change in rustdoc, I forget if that code compiles). Instead, this happened:
``` error: internal compiler error: encountered incremental compilation error with item_children(build_helper[daa7]) | = help: This is a known issue with the compiler. Run `cargo clean -p build_script_build` or `cargo clean` to allow your project to compile = note: Please follow the instructions below to create a bug report with the provided information = note: See for more information thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Found unstable fingerprints for item_children(build_helper[daa7]): [Export { ident: tracked_env_var_os#0, res: Def(Fn, DefId(19:42 ~ build_helper[daa7]::tracked_env_var_os)), span: /home/joshua/rustc/src/build_helper/lib.rs:36:1: 36:81 (#0), vis: Public }, Export { ident: restore_library_path#0, res: Def(Fn, DefId(19:44 ~ build_helper[daa7]::restore_library_path)), span: /home/joshua/rustc/src/build_helper/lib.rs:49:1: 49:30 (#0), vis: Public }, Export { ident: run_verbose#0, res: Def(Fn, DefId(19:45 ~
